title: Automatic generation of algorithm animations in a programming environment
abstract: The design and analysis of algorithms is one of the core fields of computer science, and their study is an intellectually demanding task. Animations are promising educational aids for the study of algorithms, but the main obstacle for an extensive educational use is the technical difficulty of producing them. This fact dissuades many teachers and most students from building animations. We report the facilities for algorithm animation we have integrated in a functional programming environment. One of our main concerns was to simplify the generation of animations to the extent of being as simple as handling an office application. In addition, the integration of animation generation with the programming environment produces synergy benefits. title: Automatic Web publishing of algorithm animations
abstract: We are undertaking a research action to simplifying the creation of program animations in order to foster a wider adoption of animations for CS education. In this article, we report on an extension of the WinHIPE functional programming environment to generate Web pages containing algorithm animations. Its integration within the programming environment guarantees the general applicability of the animator. In addition, by means of simple dialogs to specify the graphical style of visualizations, the animation interaction, etc., the generation of Web pages with animations is achieved automatically. We expect that the automatic nature of our extensions will encourage students to play an active role in learning and teachers to generate active documents containing active algorithm animations.

title: Valoración de la eficacia de las animaciones de algoritmos en el aprendizaje de la programación funcional
abstract: Aunque cada día es más frecuente el empleo de las tecnologías de visualización del software en la enseñanza, no se ha determinado de manera concluyente en qué medida favorecen el aprendizaje. Los beneficios, al menos intuitivamente, parecen ser numerosos, pero los variados experimentos que han sido realizados para conocer la eficacia pedagógica de la visualización de software no han conseguido resultados rotundos. En este artículo se describe el desarrollo de un experimento para la valoración de la eficacia de las animaciones de algoritmos en el aprendizaje de la programación funcional y las conclusiones obtenidas.
